availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1859-1862

body.p:
Louisville, Ky., March 20th, 1861.
Secretary of the State of Kentucky
Frankfort, Ky,,
Dear Sir --

Allow me to call your special attention to a bill, passed in both houses of the Legislature last, called "An Act, to incorporate Louisville Lodge Ky. 81, I. O. O. F. This Lodge is very anxious -- as I worte you frequently -- to have the Act duly signed by the proper authorities, on fine strong paper. I should very much obliged to you, if you would attend to this, and send me the incorporation act. All trouble and expenses you may have of it, please charge me I shall remit the money with return of mail. With greatest Respect I am

Your humble &c
Krippen Stapel,
Anzeiger office
